board.note: The lower-right square (from White's perspective) is always light (h1).

advance.first_move: optionally 2 squares forward if not moved yet

promotion.when: upon reaching the opposite end of the board (rank 8 for White, rank 1 for Black)

pieces.name: Rook

movement.range: any number of squares without jumping over pieces

pieces.capture: same as movement (occupies the enemy piece's square)

pieces.name: Knight

movement.details: 2 squares in one direction (horizontal or vertical) + 1 square perpendicular

pieces.capture: lands on and replaces the opponent's piece

movement.range: any number of squares diagonally without jumping
movement.color_bound: remains on the same color of square it starts on

movement.details: combines rook and bishop moves: horizontally, vertically, or diagonally
movement.range: any number of squares without jumping

pieces.name: King

movement.details: 1 square in any direction (horizontal, vertical, diagonal)

pieces.capture: moves onto the opponent's piece (if safe)

castling.description: A special move involving the king and a rook. The king moves two squares toward the rook, and the rook moves to the square next to the king on the opposite side.
conditions: Neither the king nor the involved rook has moved before.
No pieces between the king and rook.
The king cannot be in check before, during, or after castling.

examples.short: White: king e1 + rook h1 -> king g1, rook f1

examples.long: White: king e1 + rook a1 -> king c1, rook d1

en_passant.description: A special pawn capture available immediately after an opposing pawn advances two squares and lands beside your pawn.
conditions: Can only be performed immediately after the opponent's double pawn move.
The capturing pawn moves diagonally to the square the enemy pawn passed through.
en_passant.example: White pawn on e5, Black plays d7->d5; White can capture en passant on d6 only on the next move.

promotion.description: When a pawn reaches the final rank, it must be promoted to another piece (Queen, Rook, Bishop, or Knight) of the same color.
notes: You may have multiple queens or other pieces.

types.stalemate: The player has no legal moves and their king is not in check (draw).

types.threefold_repetition: The same position occurs three times with the same player to move; draw may be claimed.

types.fifty_move_rule: Fifty consecutive moves without a pawn move or capture; draw may be claimed.

algebraic.description: Standard chess notation: piece letter (K,Q,R,B,N; pawns omit the letter) + destination square. 'x' means capture, '+' check, '#' checkmate.

practice: Place pieces on a board and practice each movement individually.
Do drills: for example, move only knights for 10 minutes, then pawns, etc.
Play short games to become familiar with the flow of play.
study_order_recommendation: 1) Pawns and King (basic movement and promotion).
